abstract: The drop comes as the bank prepares this year to replace its chief executive with William T. Winters, the former head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank.
snippet: The drop comes as the bank prepares this year to replace its chief executive with William T. Winters, the former head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British bank Standard Chartered, which generates most of its earnings in Asia, said on Tuesday that its profit had declined 22 percent in the first quarter. The bank cited an exit from some business lines, an increase in impairments for bad loans and “challenging” trading conditions, particularly in currency-hedging products.

headline.main: Standard Chartered Profit Declined 22 Percent in First Quarter

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
